title: Legacy lessc parameter (--yui-compress) causes side effects on CSS imports
body:
The `--yui-compress` parameter available in previous versions of lessc
was removed from 1.5.0 (without any mention in the change log):

``` bash
lessc --version

# >> lessc 1.5.0 (LESS Compiler) [JavaScript]

lessc --help | grep -q yui-compress; echo $?

# >> 1
```

And when used (in 1.5.0), it causes no error (and even compresses the
output, like `-x`):

``` less
/* @main.less */

html, body {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
}
```

``` bash
lessc main.less; echo $?

# >> body {
# >>   margin: 0;
# >>   padding: 0;
# >> }
# >> 0

lessc --yui-compress main.less; echo $?

# >> html,body{margin:0;padding:0}0

lessc -x main.less; echo $?

# >> html,body{margin:0;padding:0}0
```

In fact, lessc doesn't check for invalid parameters at all, even with
the `--verbose` parameter, so it's harder to debug (and developers doesn't
get notified when a paramater is removed):

``` bash
lessc --verbose --foo --bar main.less >/dev/null; echo $?

# >> 0
```

But what's worse is that the `--yui-compress` parameter has a side effect
that produces a different result than in previous versions of lessc:

``` less
/* @main.less */

@import url("colors.css");
```

``` css
/* @colors.css */

body {
    background-color: #f00;
}
```

With different parameters:

``` bash
lessc main.less

# >> @import url("colors.css");

lessc -x main.less

# >> @import url("colors.css");

lessc -O2 -x main.less

# >> @import url("colors.css");

lessc --yui-compress main.less

# >> body{background-color:red}
```

No error, just an unexpected and undocumented result. This breaks
relative paths if the CSS file is in another directory. Things get even
worse when source files are in separate directories:

``` bash
mkdir lib src
mv colors.css lib
mv main.less src
sed -i 's:colors.css:../lib/colors.css:' src/main.less

lessc src/main.less; echo $?

# >> @import url("../lib/colors.css");
# >> 0

lessc --yui-compress src/main.less; echo $?

# >> 0
```

This produces no outout: CSS `@import` lines are simply ignored. Also:

``` bash
sed -i 's:import:import (inline):' src/main.less

lessc src/main.less

# >> body {
# >>    background-color: #f00;
# >> }

less --yui-compress src/main.less

# >> body{background-color:red}
```

Version 1.5.0 (the one that comes by default with npm) breaks backward
compatibility and have some unexpected results. I think:
- `--yui-compress` should be disabled as it's no more documented and has
  tricky, backward-incompatible effects
- there should be an invalid parameter check, with exit status <> 0
- there should be a mention about the removal of `--yui-compress` in the
  [change log](https://github.com/less/less.js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
  and a list of alternative parameters (e.g. `-x`)
